intro: Cerastium mutabile var. grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are velvety and heart-shaped, while its stems are prostrate and often covered in fine hairs. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging soil conditions.
